db:abstract.db:para: The QContextMenuEvent class contains parameters that describe a context menu event.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Context menu events are sent to widgets when a user performs an action associated with opening a context menu. The actions required to open context menus vary between platforms; for example, on Windows, pressing the menu button or clicking the right mouse button will cause this event to be sent.
When this event occurs it is customary to show a QMenu with a context menu, if this is relevant to the context.

db:section.db:title: enum QContextMenuEvent::Reason
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the reason why the event was sent.

db:td.db:para: The mouse caused the event to be sent. Normally this means the right mouse button was clicked, but this is platform dependent.
The keyboard caused this event to be sent. On Windows, this means the menu button was pressed.
The event was sent by some other means (i.e. not by the mouse or keyboard).

db:section.db:title: QContextMenuEvent::QContextMenuEvent(QContextMenuEvent::Reason reason, const QPoint &pos, const QPoint &globalPos, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers = Qt::NoModifier)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a context menu event object with the accept parameter flag set to false.
The reason parameter must be QContextMenuEvent::Mouse or QContextMenuEvent::Keyboard.
The pos parameter specifies the mouse position relative to the receiving widget. globalPos is the mouse position in absolute coordinates. The modifiers holds the keyboard modifiers.

db:section.db:title: const QPoint &QContextMenuEvent::globalPos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the global position of the mouse pointer at the time of the event.

db:section.db:title: int QContextMenuEvent::globalX() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the global x position of the mouse pointer at the time of the event.

db:section.db:title: int QContextMenuEvent::globalY() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the global y position of the mouse pointer at the time of the event.

db:section.db:title: const QPoint &QContextMenuEvent::pos() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the position of the mouse pointer relative to the widget that received the event.

db:section.db:title: QContextMenuEvent::Reason QContextMenuEvent::reason() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the reason for this context event.

db:section.db:title: int QContextMenuEvent::x() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the x position of the mouse pointer, relative to the widget that received the event.

db:section.db:title: int QContextMenuEvent::y() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the y position of the mouse pointer, relative to the widget that received the event.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QContextMenuEvent
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QContextMenuEvent are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated in 6.4] QContextMenuEvent::QContextMenuEvent(QContextMenuEvent::Reason reason, const QPoint &pos)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated since 6.4. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use the other constructor instead (global position is required).
Constructs a context menu event object with the accept parameter flag set to false.
The reason parameter must be QContextMenuEvent::Mouse or QContextMenuEvent::Keyboard.
The pos parameter specifies the mouse position relative to the receiving widget.
The globalPos() is initialized to QCursor::pos(), which may not be appropriate. Use the other constructor to specify the global position explicitly.
